etymology.description: Pictogram: a wooden bifurcated plow/harrow with three cross lines (彡, 丯) marking furrows, later simplified to two.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a forked wooden tilling implement seen from above, with short strokes indicating the furrows it cuts. Over time scribes reduced the number of furrow marks, but the form still clearly evokes an agricultural tool, sometimes glossed as a harrow.

examples.chinese: 他手持耒在田间翻土(他手持耒在田間翻土)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shǒu chí lěi zài tiánjiān fān tǔ.
examples.english: He held a plow to turn the soil in the fields.

examples.chinese: 古人以耒耜耕田(古人以耒耜耕田)。
examples.english: The ancients tilled fields with a plow and hoe.

examples.chinese: 文物展出了青铜耒(文物展出了青銅耒)。
examples.english: The exhibit displayed a bronze plow.
